title: Chord: Diminished 7th in G# (Shape: A)
content:
# Chord: Diminished 7th in G# (Shape: A)

## Description
The Diminished 7th chord is a four-note chord built by stacking minor thirds. In this case, we are looking at a Diminished 7th chord in the key of G# with the shape of an A chord. This chord is made up of the notes G# - B - D - F.

## Notes and Intervals
- G#: Root
- B: Minor 3rd
- D: Diminished 5th
- F: Diminished 7th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Diminished 7th chord is commonly used in jazz, classical, and some progressive rock styles. It creates tension and instability due to its diminished qualities, adding a sense of suspense and a desire for resolution. This chord is often utilized to create dissonance and drama in music.

## Songs
1. "Blue Monk" by Thelonious Monk
2. "Tom Sawyer" by Rush
3. "Sweet Child O' Mine" by Guns N' Roses
